  • |Table attributes
  • Latest release: 0.9.0|

<table> attributes

Usage

The <table> attributes allow you to configure the main features of DataTables, including DataTables enablement.

You can either use a "DOM" source, i.e. a Java collection previously set in the page or request scope or an "AJAX" source, i.e. using a web service that must return data formatted in JSON. 

<table id="myTableId" dt:table="true">
   <thead>
      <tr>
         <th>Id</th>
         <th>Firstname</th>
         <th>Lastname</th>
         <th>City</th>
         <th>Mail</th>
      </tr>
   </thead>
   <tbody>
      <tr th:each="person : ${myCollection}">
         <td th:text="${person.id}">1</td>
         <td th:text="${person.firstName}">John</td>
         <td th:text="${person.lastName}">Doe</td>
         <td th:text="${person.address.town.name}">Nobody knows!</td>
         <td th:text="${person.mail}">john@doe.com</td>
      </tr>
   </tbody>
</table>

You will find in the bellowing table all the available attributes for this tag.

Reference

Name Description Value(s) Default value Data source compatibility Corresponding configuration name
dt:table (required) Enables Dandelion-Datatables in a Thymeleaf template. The value must be true true|false DOM AJAX n/a
dt:url Web service URL used to populate the table AJAX n/a
dt:appear DOM AJAX extra.appear
dt:cdn DOM AJAX extra.cdn
dt:info Enable or disable the table information display. This shows information about the data that is currently visible on the page, including information about filtered data if that action is being performed true|false true DOM AJAX feature.info
dt:paginate Enable or disable pagination true|false true DOM AJAX feature.paginate
dt:lengthChange If paginate is enabled, allows the end user to select the size of a formatted page from a select menu (sizes are 10, 25, 50 and 100) true|false true DOM AJAX feature.lengthChange
dt:filter Enable or disable filtering of data true true|false DOM AJAX feature.filter
dt:filterPlaceholder Placeholder used to hold the individual column filtering elements head_before|head_after|foot|none foot DOM AJAX feature.filterplaceholder
dt:sort Enable or disable sorting of columns. Sorting of individual columns can be disabled by the "sortable" attribute of column tag true|false true DOM AJAX feature.sort
dt:autowidth Enable or disable automatic column width calculation true|false true DOM AJAX feature.autoWidth
dt:displaylength Number of rows to display on a single page when using pagination 10 DOM AJAX feature.displayLength
dt:paginationtype Choice between the different built-in pagination interaction methods which present different page controls to the end user two_button|
full_numbers|
four_button|
bootstrap|
scrolling|
input|
listbox|
extJs 		two_button DOM AJAX feature.paginationType
dt:export Comma-separated list of allowed export types csv|xml|pdf|xls|xlsx DOM AJAX export.types
dt:theme Name of a theme to activate for the current table bootstrap2 | jqueryui DOM AJAX css.theme
dt:themeOption Name of an option to activate in relation to the current activated theme. See the full list DOM AJAX css.themeOption
dt:serverside Configure DataTables to use server-side processing. true|false false AJAX ajax.serverSide
dt:pipelining Enable pipelining data for paging when server-side processing is enabled. true|false false AJAX ajax.pipelining
dt:pipesize Pipe size used when pipelining is enabled, i.e. times that the user can page before a request must be made of the server. 5 AJAX ajax.pipeSize
dt:processing Enable or disable the display of a 'processing' indicator when the table is being processed (e.g. a sort). This is particularly useful for tables with large amounts of data where it can take a noticeable amount of time to sort the entries true|false false AJAX ajax.processing
dt:exportLinks Comma-separated list of positions where the export links will be generated top_left| top_middle| top_right| bottom_left| bottom_middle| bottom_right top_right DOM AJAX export.links
dt:lengthmenu Specify the entries in the length drop down menu that DataTables show when pagination is enabled DOM AJAX feature.lengthMenu
dt:serverdata Allows you to override the default function which obtains the data from the server ($.getJSON) so something more suitable for your application AJAX ajax.serverData
dt:serverparams Allows you to send extra information to the server when using AJAX source AJAX ajax.serverParams
dt:stripeclasses Comma-separated list of CSS classes that should be applied to displayed rows. This sequence of CSS classes may be of any length, and DataTables will apply each class sequentially, looping when required. DOM AJAX css.stripeClasses
dt:scrollx Table's width to display in scrolling mode DOM AJAX feature.scrollX
dt:scrollxinner Use more width than it might otherwise do when x-scrolling is enabled DOM AJAX feature.scrollXInner
dt:scrolly (scroller) Table's height to display in scrolling mode. Any CSS unit, or a number (in which case it will be treated as a pixel measurement) 300px DOM AJAX feature.scrollY
dt:ext Comma-separated list of names of custom extensions to register in the current table. Note that the extensions must be scanned using the main.extension.package configuration. DOM AJAX main.extension.names
dt:scrollcollapse When vertical (y) scrolling is enabled, DataTables will force the height of the table's viewport to the given height at all times (useful for layout). However, this can look odd when filtering data down to a small data set, and the footer is left "floating" further down. This parameter (when enabled) will cause DataTables to collapse the table's viewport down when the result set will fit within the given Y height. true|false false DOM AJAX feature.scrollCollapse
dt:dom Allows you to specify exactly where in the DOM you want DataTables to inject the various controls it adds to the page (for example you might want the pagination controls at the top of the table). DIV elements (with or without a custom class) can also be added to aid styling. lfrtip DOM AJAX feature.dom
